Mouth Animator Component

The Mouth Animator component is responsible for managing and caching mouth shape change requests, then forwarding them to the Mouth Renderer for display. This setup ensures smooth, responsive transitions between mouth shapes in line with character animation requirements. FaceToons includes two versions of the Mouth Animator to accommodate different visual needs:

Mouth Animator Single

The Mouth Animator Single is designed for characters with single-angle mouth shapes, where the mouth texture remains consistent regardless of the character's viewing angle.

Mouth Animator Double

The Mouth Animator Double is tailored for characters needing camera-dependent mouth shapes. It employs two textures—typically a front-facing and a side-view frame—and mirrors the side-view texture based on the camera's direction. Additionally, this version repositions the mouth projection transform, keeping the GameObject always aligned with the camera. This feature is particularly effective for flat, 2D-style characters or decal workflows.

MouthAnimatorDouble's camera-relative logic will update in edit-mode only when one of the following is met:

  • Component is selected and Gizmos are on.
  • Scrubbing / Playing the Timeline with Mouth Track.

You can force edit-mode updates to be per-frame by ticking the 'Update in Edit Mode' checkbox.
